Firstly, is that even how you spell concurrent?
 
 Secondly, what do the good people of the internet think about the practice of a convicted criminal serving two sentences at the same time. For example, a person is charged with stealing a car and assault at the same time, and is given a five year sentence for each, to be served concurrently. So the criminal ends up serving a total of five years.
 
 I can see where this might be useful in cases where one charge is over-turned, and the other isn't, but I don't think it is a practice that adequately serves to punish criminals, or protect other citizens.
 
 Opinions?

what would be the point? Shouldn't a criminal serve their entire time in prison according to the crime? 
 
 Seems dumb to me.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Concurrent sentencing?
